description: Describe previous term from the right (method B - initial term is 1).
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..24
example: E.g. the term after 1321 is obtained by saying "1 once, 2 once, 3 once, 1 once", which gives 11213111.
prog: (Haskell)import Data.List (group, transpose)a022481 n = a022481_list !! (n-1)a022481_list = 1 : f [1] :: [Integer] where   f xs = (read $ concatMap show ys) : f ys where          ys = concat $ transpose [map head zss, map length zss]          zss = reverse $ group xs-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jan 26 2014
